info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 24 at 2:29PM PDT until October 24 at 4:30PM PDT by NWS Seattle WA
info.description:
A cold front is moving through the Puget Sound area dropping a narrow band of heavy rain from about Mukilteo to Sedro Woolley, moving east.
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of northwest and west central Washington, including the following counties, in northwest Washington, Skagit. In west central Washington, Snohomish.
* WHEN...Until 430 PM PDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 226 PM PDT, Doppler radar and rain gauges indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 0.8 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Everett, Marysville, Arlington, Sedro-Woolley, Gold Bar, Darrington, Concrete, Lake Stevens, Mukilteo, Monroe, Snohomish, Sultan, Granite Falls, Lake Cavanaugh, Verlot, Lake Mcmurray, Rockport, Woods Creek, Lake Goodwin and Marblemount. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON
